claim: Worker identity must not be repo name; workerId must remain stable for concurrency and operator observability.
OpenCode server instances must not be shared across different worktrees; default is one server per active worktree.
The parent verification agent emits a last-line marker `RALPH_PARENT_VERIFY: {"version":1,...}`.
SQLite under `~/.ralph` stores durable internal state (sessions, worktrees, cursors, run records).

Ralph escalates only when it cannot safely proceed without human intervention. Escalation sensitivity is driven only by `ralph:*` labels plus deterministic markers and contract-surface detection; ignore non-`ralph:*` labels.
For concurrent work, Ralph may isolate mutable tool caches per repo/task (for example: set a per-worktree `XDG_CACHE_HOME`) to avoid cross-task cache contamination and concurrency hazards.
Dashboard events stream is append-only; consumers should treat event payloads as extensible.
`/v1/events` supports replay via `replayLast` with default and max clamping; non-numeric values fall back to default.
Ralph persists control-plane events to JSONL and deletes logs older than 14 days by default (configurable).
